greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = smallest prime p such that the first n iterates of p under x->2x+1 are all primes.
link: C. K. Caldwell, Latest results about Cunningham Chains
Index entries for sequences related to primes in arithmetic progressions
example: a(5) = 89 because the numbers 89, 179, 359, 719, 1439, 2879 are all primes and 89 is the first number to have this property.
mathematica: f[n_] := 2n + 1; k = 1; Do[ While[ Union[ PrimeQ[ NestList[ f, Prime[k], n]]] != {True}, k++ ]; Print[ Prime[k]], {n, 1, 9} ]
program: a(n)=forprime(p=2,, if(has(p,n), return(p))) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 29 2015
results.author: _Patrick De Geest_, Aug 15 2000
ext: a(11) (from the Caldwell link) sent by Peter Deleu, Hulste, Belgium, Nov 22 2004
